title: 0 of X required images are available in the registry
content:
You successfully download and upload images to the registry. When you try to deploy a suite on Amazon EKS, you receive an error message that resembles the following on the "Check Image Availability" page of the installation portal:

0 of 96 required images are available in the registry

This issue is most likely to occur when the installation process takes 12 hours or longer.

Cause

This issue occurs because Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) uses short-lived credentials, whereas the OMT credentials (registrypullsecret) are long-lived. Therefore, the OMT credentials may expire when the installation process takes a long time.

Solution

A script (refresh-ecr-secret.sh) is available to refresh the OMT credentials. To use the script, follow these steps:

  1. On the Amazon EKS bastion node, run the following command:

    ./<ITOM_Platform_Foundation_BYOK_20XX.XX.00XXX.zip>/scripts/refresh-ecr-secret.sh -r <region>

    In this command, <ITOM_Platform_Foundation_BYOK_20XX.XX.00XXX.zip> represents your installation package directory and <region> represents your Amazon ECR region.
  2. Return to the "Check Image Availability" page of the Installation portal, and then click Next.
